result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack Lang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court ordered defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release to extended supervision, but remain a condition of extended supervision.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 290 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (19 pages) commencing JANUARY 30, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Jack Lang in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Jack Lang in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Hillary L.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 16 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 290 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 8 
YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Mental Health Assessment.
*No weapons
*Pay all costs and discharges.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $2000.00 to Dr.Rawski for services on 9/24, 10/10, 10/4, 10/11,10/20, 10/21, 10/24.
COPY IN FILE.

CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 10.  As to amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court will order a PSI and remand defendant pending sentencing on 1-30-2015 at 8:30am Branch 10.
Order for PSI signed and filed.

Defendant Jack Lang in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Jack Lang in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed:  First Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, 940.02(1).

Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael F. Hart in court, defendant Jack Lang not in court, in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Doctor Rawski requests more time time to complete report.    Case is adjourned for return on doctor's report, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Vacate 10-13-2014 date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jack Lang in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Jack Lang in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney Mark Williams and to the defendant's Attorney, Michael Hart.
Defendant does not contest doctor's report.  Court finds defendant is competent to proceed.   Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   
Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Robert Rawski be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 10.
Filed, signed Order for Examination.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael F. Hart in court, defendant Jack Lang not in court, in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 10.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jack Lang in court with attorney Michael F Hart.  Defendant Jack Lang in custody.  Nicole Sheldon for Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jack Lang in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Jack Lang in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR A PUBLIC DEFENDER.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
